   no true localizing symptoms elsewhere besides fevers and generalized
   body aches.  Chest CT did possibly show an underlying infection, but
   difficult to detemine given his underlying ILD.  Does have HIV,

   initially respond to fluid boluses.  Has since normalized.  Most likely
   secondary to infection and venodilation.  .  Could be adrenal
   insufficiency, although hasn't been on chronic steroids.  Cardiac shock
   less likely given normal EKG and lack of chest pain.
   - continue IVF boluses PRN for MAP <60

   - Replete PRN

   - follow up on recent CD4 counts

   relative [**Name (NI) 12352**], could represent underlying infection.  Has
   negative LP and CT head in ED.
   - tylenol PRN for pain
   - f/u CSF cultures, but no abx coverage for meningitis
   # Conjunctivitis: again, likely from a viral illness.  Is asymptomatic
   at this point, but will monitor clinically.
   - saline eye gtts for now
   - consider cipro gtt if patient becomes more symptomatic
   .
   # ILD: has underlying ILD that has been stable, and today seems at
   baseline.  Reviewing CT scan has stable honeycombing in the peripheries
   and more ground glass infiltrates consistent with different process,
   likely infectious as discussed above.
   - continue nebs
   - PNA/flu treatment as above
   .
   # HIV: on HARRT and per old labs, has high CD4 around 600.  Will need
   to contact outpatient doctor to review meds, recent labs and
   prophylaxis plans for him.
   - continue current regimen
   - contact PCP
   [**Name Initial (PRE) **] consider adding prophylaxis based on CD4 count
   .
   # Scleroderma: stable, continue to monitor for now
   .
   # Anemia: had normal hct on presentation and down from 41 to 37 after
   6L of IVFs, so value is likley dilutional.  No reason to suspect
   bleeding elsewhere.
   - guiac stools
   - trend hct
   .
